structuralFindings.rationale: Based on existing specimen classification. New observations from earnings/research session.
structuralFindings.aiTeamStructure: Dimon confirmed JPMorgan 'took AI, slash data, out of technology' — a deliberate structural reorganization to elevate AI's strategic importance. Teresa Heitsenrether serves as Chief Data & Analytics O

quotes.text: We will be spending more in AI.
quotes.speaker: Jamie Dimon
quotes.context: Q4 2025 earnings call, confirming increased AI investment in 2026

quotes.text: it'll be driving more efficiency down the road... [that] will eventually be passed on to the customer.
quotes.speaker: Jamie Dimon
quotes.context: Describing AI's expected trajectory from internal efficiency to customer benefit

quotes.text: Your competitors include all the FinTech. You have Stripe, you have SoFi, you have Revolut, you have Schwab.
quotes.speaker: Jamie Dimon
quotes.context: Framing JPMorgan's tech spending as competitive necessity against non-traditional competitors

quotes.speaker: Jeremy Barnum
quotes.context: Justifying meaningful expense growth in 2026, particularly technology spending

quotes.text: For $2 billion of expense, we have about $2 billion of benefit.
quotes.speaker: Jamie Dimon
quotes.context: October 2025 remarks on AI investment ROI, calling it 'just the tip of the iceberg'

sources.name: AI separated from Technology as distinct organizational function

sources.name: $2B annual AI investment yielding $2B in benefits
sources.notes: $2B annual AI investment yielding $2B in benefits

summary: AI separated from Technology as distinct organizational function: Dimon confirmed JPMorgan 'took AI, slash data, out of technology' — a deliberate structural reorganization to elevate AI's strategic importance. Teresa Heitsenrether serves as Chief Data & Analytics O $2B annual AI investment yielding $2B in benefits: Dimon stated 'For $2 billion of expense, we have about $2 billion of benefit' from AI. This represents a break-even point with the bank viewing current returns as 'just the tip of the iceberg.' Cash f 150K weekly active AI users and 2K AI specialists: Approximately 150,000 employees per week use JPMorgan's internal AI model. The bank employs around 2,000 AI and machine learning experts. Bank has used AI since 2012, with use cases spanning risk mana 2026 expense guidance: $105B total, 'meaningful' growth driven by tech/AI: CFO Jeremy Barnum described 2026 as 'meaningful expense growth in both dollar and percentage terms' — boosting spending by more than $9B to ~$105B.
